title: How to Make Banana and Strawberry Jello Salad

steps.headline: Make the strawberry jello.
steps.description: Don't put it into individual molds; put it all in one bowl. Make Jello

steps.headline: Put the jello and cool whip together into a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Whisk until they are well-blended, or until the jello mostly dissolves into the Cool Whip.

steps.headline: Fold in the cottage cheese, strawberries, and bananas.
Cover the top of the bowl with plastic wrap.
Put into refrigerator and take it out whenever you want.
Cut the bananas up.
steps.description: Don't make them thin; make them big enough so that there's 5-6 slices of banana per banana.

steps.headline: Cut each of the strawberries in half and remove the stem.
Add water to the saucepan.
steps.description: Whisk in the cornstarch and add the sugar.

steps.headline: Add the strawberry jello and blend in evenly.
Put the mixture in a bowl and cool completely.
Add the strawberries and bananas and stir (carefully, so that the fruit isn't squashed) until all the fruit is covered in the sauce.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and leave it in the refrigerator for about an hour, or until it sets.
Serve plain or with whipped cream.

text: Steps Make the strawberry jello. Don't put it into individual molds; put it all in one bowl. Make Jello Put the jello and cool whip together into a large mixing bowl. Whisk until they are well-blended, or until the jello mostly dissolves into the Cool Whip. Fold in the cottage cheese, strawberries, and bananas.  Cover the top of the bowl with plastic wrap.  Put into refrigerator and take it out whenever you want.  Version 2- buffet version Cut the bananas up. Don't make them thin; make them big enough so that there's 5-6 slices of banana per banana. Cut each of the strawberries in half and remove the stem.  Add water to the saucepan. Whisk in the cornstarch and add the sugar. Boil until it thickens. This will take around 3-5 minutes. Add the strawberry jello and blend in evenly.  Put the mixture in a bowl and cool completely.  Add the strawberries and bananas and stir (carefully, so that the fruit isn't squashed) until all the fruit is covered in the sauce.  Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and leave it in the refrigerator for about an hour, or until it sets.  Serve plain or with whipped cream.
